item.name: Jeweler's Tools
additionalEntries: Training with jeweler's tools includes the basic techniques needed to beautify gems. It also gives you expertise in identifying precious stones.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Jeweler's tools consist of a small saw and hammer, files, pliers, and tweezers.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana
entries: Proficiency with jeweler's tools grants you knowledge about the reputed mystical uses of gems. This insight proves handy when you make {@skill Arcana} checks related to gems or gem-encrusted items.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: When you inspect jeweled objects, your proficiency with jeweler's tools aids you in picking out clues they might hold.

additionalEntries.name: Identify Gems
entries: You can identify gems and determine their value at a glance.

item.name: Jug
entries: A jug holds 1 gallon of liquid.

item.name: Keelboat
entries: Keelboats and rowboats are used on lakes and rivers. If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores.

item.name: Ladder (10-foot)
entries: Ladder (10-foot)

item.name: Lamp
entries: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Leaf in the Shape of a Funnel
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Maelstrom|XGE}.

item.name: Leaf of Sumac
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Flame Blade|PHB}.

item.name: Leather Armor
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

item.name: Leather Barding
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

item.name: Leather Strap
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Freedom of Movement|PHB}.

item.name: Leatherworker's Tools
additionalEntries: Knowledge of leatherworking extends to lore concerning animal hides and their properties. It also confers knowledge of leather armor and similar goods.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Leatherworker's tools include a knife, a small mallet, an edger, a hole punch, thread, and leather scraps.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana
entries: Your expertise in working with leather grants you added insight when you inspect magic items crafted from leather, such as boots and some cloaks.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: You gain added insight when studying leather items or clues related to them, as you draw on your knowledge of leather to pick out details that others would overlook.

additionalEntries.name: Identify Hides
entries: When looking at a hide or a leather item, you can determine the source of the leather and any special techniques used to treat it. For example, you can spot the difference between leather crafted using dwarven methods and leather crafted using halfling methods.

item.name: Legume Seed
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Gust of Wind|PHB}.

item.name: Living Flea
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Infestation (UA)|UAStarterSpells} and {@spell Infestation|XGE}.

item.name: Loam
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Move Earth|PHB}.

item.name: Lock
entries: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with {@item thieves' tools|phb} can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your DM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

item.name: Lodestone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Disintegrate|PHB} and {@spell Reverse Gravity|PHB}.

item.name: Longhorn
entries: A Faerûnian flute of sophisticated make, found only in areas with skilled artisans, as in great cities or elven enclaves.

item.name: Lump of Clay
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Earthquake|PHB}.

item.name: Magnifying Glass
entries: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

item.name: Magnifying Glass
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sunbeam|PHB}.

item.name: Malice
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition blinded}.

item.name: Manacles
entries: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with {@item thieves' tools|PHB} can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

item.name: Map or Scroll Case
entries: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up {@item paper (one sheet)|phb|sheets of paper} or five rolled-up {@item parchment (one sheet)|phb|sheets of parchment}.

item.name: Mason's Tools
additionalEntries: Mason's tools allow you to craft stone structures, including walls and buildings crafted from brick.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Mason's tools consist of a trowel, a hammer, a chisel, brushes, and a square.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in identifying a stone building's date of construction and purpose, along with insight into who might have built it.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: You gain additional insight when inspecting areas within stone structures.

additionalEntries.name: Perception
entries: You can spot irregularities in stone walls or floors, making it easier to find trap doors and secret passages.

additionalEntries.name: Demolition
entries: Your knowledge of masonry allows you to spot weak points in brick walls. You deal double damage to such structures with your weapon attacks.

additionalEntries.caption: Mason's Tools
rows: Chisel a small hole in a stone wall
Find a weak point in a stone wall

item.name: Matching Hemispherical Piece of Gum Arabic
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere|PHB}.

item.name: Melee Weapon Worth at Least 1 Sp
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE}.

item.name: Merchant's Scale
entries: A scale includes a small balance, pans, and a suitable assortment of weights up to 2 pounds. With it, you can measure the exact weight of small objects, such as raw precious metals or trade goods, to help determine their worth.

item.name: Mess Kit
entries: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

item.name: Midnight Tears
entries: A creature that ingests this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Military Saddle
entries: A military saddle braces the rider, helping you keep your seat on an active mount in battle. It gives you advantage on any check you make to remain mounted.

item.name: Mineral Spheres
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Feeblemind|PHB}.

item.name: Miniature Cloak
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Resistance|PHB}.

item.name: Miniature Hand Sculpted from Clay
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE}.

item.name: Mistletoe
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Shillelagh|PHB}.

item.name: Mobile Phone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Infallible Relay (UA)|UAModernMagic}.

item.name: Moorbounder
entries: Beasts of burden are common throughout Xhorhas, and often horses and other riding animals are the best or only option. For those who require speed and have a little more coin to spend, the best option is often a moorbounder. However, moorbounders that haven't undergone proper training or established bonds of trust with their masters tend to attack and even eat their riders.
Moorbounders can cost anywhere from 300 to 500 gp each. They're often cheaper and more abundant in towns on the wastes than in cities like Rosohna.

item.name: More Arrows
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Cordon of Arrows|PHB}.

item.name: Morsel of Food
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Animal Friendship|PHB} and {@spell Animal Messenger|PHB}.

item.name: Murgaxor's Elixir of Life
entries: Whoever drinks this concoction gains advantage on death saving throws for 24 hours.

item.name: Muroosa Balm
entries: This paste made from the muroosa bush is known to help prevent sunburn, but it is also a fire retardant. After spending 1 minute applying a quarter pint of muroosa balm to your skin, you gain resistance against fire damage for 1 hour.
A dose of muroosa balm sufficient for treating sunburn costs 1 gp.

item.name: Musical Instrument
items: Bagpipes|PHB
Drum|PHB
Dulcimer|PHB
Flute|PHB
Horn|PHB
Lute|PHB
Lyre|PHB
Pan Flute|PHB
Shawm|PHB
Viol|PHB

item.name: Musical Instrument
items: Birdpipes|SCAG
Glaur|SCAG
Hand Drum|SCAG
Longhorn|SCAG
Shawm|SCAG
Songhorn|SCAG
Tantan|SCAG
Thelarr|SCAG
Tocken|SCAG
Wargong|SCAG
Yarting|SCAG
Zulkoon|SCAG

item.name: Navigator's Tools
entries: This set of instruments is used for navigation at sea. Proficiency with navigator's tools lets you chart a ship's course and follow navigation charts. In addition, these tools allow you to add your proficiency bonus to any ability check you make to avoid getting lost at sea.
additionalEntries: Proficiency with navigator's tools helps you determine a true course based on observing the stars. It also grants you insight into charts and maps while developing your sense of direction.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Navigator's tools include a sextant, a compass, calipers, a ruler, parchment, ink, and a quill.

additionalEntries.name: Survival
entries: Knowledge of navigator's tools helps you avoid becoming lost and also grants you insight into the most likely location for roads and settlements.

additionalEntries.name: Sighting
entries: By taking careful measurements, you can determine your position on a nautical chart and the time of day.

additionalEntries.caption: Navigator's Tools
rows: Discover your position on a nautical chart

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

item.name: Niter
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Melf's Minute Meteors|XGE}.

item.name: Oil (flask)
entries: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

item.name: Oil of Taggit
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition unconscious}. The creature wakes up if it takes damage.

item.name: Olisuba Leaf
entries: These dried leaves of the Olisuba tree, when steeped to make a tea, can help a body recover from strenuous activity. If you drink a dose of Olisuba tea during a long rest, your {@condition exhaustion} level is reduced by 2 instead of 1 at the end of that long rest.

item.name: One Copper Piece Placed on Each of the Corpse's Eyes
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Gentle Repose|PHB}.

item.name: One Holly Berry Per Creature Summoned
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Woodland Beings|PHB}.

item.name: One Piece of Ammunition
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Barrage|PHB} and {@spell Conjure Volley|PHB}.

item.name: One Thrown Weapon
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Volley|PHB}.

item.name: Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: Padded Barding
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: Painter's Supplies
additionalEntries: Proficiency with painter's supplies represents your ability to paint and draw. You also acquire an understanding of art history, which can aid you in examining works of art.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Painter's supplies include an easel, canvas, paints, brushes, charcoal sticks, and a palette.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana, History, Religion
entries: Your expertise aids you in uncovering lore of any sort that is attached to a work of art, such as the magical properties of a painting or the origins of a strange mural found in a dungeon.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation, Perception
entries: When you inspect a painting or a similar work of visual art, your knowledge of the practices behind creating it can grant you additional insight.

additionalEntries.name: Painting and Drawing
entries: As part of a short or long rest, you can produce a simple work of art. Although your work might lack precision, you can capture an image or a scene, or make a quick copy of a piece of art you saw.

additionalEntries.caption: Painter's Supplies
rows: Create a painting with a hidden message

item.name: Pair of Linked Silver Rings
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Telepathy|PHB}.

item.name: Pale Tincture
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned}. The {@condition poisoned} creature must repeat the saving throw every 24 hours, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage on a failed save. Until this poison ends, the damage the poison deals can't be healed by any means. After seven successful saving throws, the effect ends and the creature can heal normally.

item.name: Paper
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Maelstrom|XGE}.

item.name: Phosphorescent Moss
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Light|PHB}.

item.name: Phosphorus for Fire
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Elemental|PHB}.

item.name: Pickled Octopus Tentacle
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hunger of Hadar|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Amber
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Chain Lightning|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Bone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Coal
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Darkness|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Cork
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Water Walk|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Cured Leather
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mage Armor|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Fine Silver Wire
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Alarm|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Flesh
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Animate Dead|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Golden Wire Bent into a Cup Shape with a Long Shank on One End
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Levitate|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Ice
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Ice Knife|XGE} and {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE}.

item.name: Piece of Iron
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Heat Metal|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Obsidian
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE}.

item.name: Piece of Opalescent Feldspar
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Moonbeam|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Opaque Glass
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Rock
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Earthquake|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Straw
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Water Breathing|PHB} and {@spell Whirlwind|XGE}.

item.name: Piece of String
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Unseen Servant|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Sunstone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sunburst|PHB}.

item.name: Piece of Tentacle from a Giant Octopus
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles|PHB}.

item.name: Pieces of Eggshell from Two Different Kinds of Creatures
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Rary's Telepathic Bond|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Bone Dust
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Animate Dead|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Brimstone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Flaming Sphere|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Dirt
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Earthquake|PHB} and {@spell Longstrider|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Dust
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Control Water|PHB}, {@spell Disintegrate|PHB}, {@spell Ice Storm|PHB}, {@spell Sleet Storm|PHB}, and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE}.

item.name: Pinch of Fine Sand
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sleep|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Graveyard Dirt
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Feign Death|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Lime
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Flesh to Stone|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Powder
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Color Spray|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Powder Made by Crushing a Clear Gemstone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Wall of Force|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Powdered Iron
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Antimagic Field|PHB} and {@spell Enlarge/Reduce|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Salt
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Gentle Repose|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Sand
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Catnap|XGE}.

item.name: Pinch of Sesame Seeds
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Passwall|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Soot
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Comprehend Languages|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Sulfur
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Flame Strike|PHB}.

item.name: Pinch of Talc
entries: A spell component used in {@spell See Invisibility|PHB}.

item.name: Pine Tar Formed into a Bead
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Melf's Minute Meteors|XGE}.

item.name: Pitcher
entries: A pitcher holds 1 gallon of liquid.

item.name: Plate Armor
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

item.name: Plate Barding
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

item.name: Poisoner's Kit
entries: A poisoner's kit includes the vials, chemicals, and other equipment necessary for the creation of poisons. Proficiency with this kit lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to craft or use poisons.
Additionally, the {@book Crafting and Harvesting Poison|dmg|8|Crafting and Harvesting Poison} rules require the use of a poisoner's kit.
additionalEntries: A poisoner's kit is a favored resource for thieves, assassins, and others who engage in skulduggery. It allows you to apply poisons and create them from various materials. Your knowledge of poisons also helps you treat them.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: A poisoner's kit includes glass vials, a mortar and pestle, chemicals, and a glass stirring rod.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your training with poisons can help you when you try to recall facts about infamous poisonings.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation, Perception
entries: Your knowledge of poisons has taught you to handle those substances carefully, giving you an edge when you inspect {@condition poisoned} objects or try to extract clues from events that involve poison.

additionalEntries.name: Medicine
entries: When you treat the victim of a poison, your knowledge grants you added insight into how to provide the best care to your patient.

additionalEntries.name: Nature, Survival
entries: Working with poisons enables you to acquire lore about which plants and animals are poisonous.

additionalEntries.name: Handle Poison
entries: Your proficiency allows you to handle and apply a poison without risk of exposing yourself to its effects.

additionalEntries.caption: Poisoner's Tools
rows: Determine the effects of a poison

item.name: Portable Ram
entries: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

item.name: Potter's Tools
additionalEntries: Potter's tools are used to create a variety of ceramic objects, most typically pots and similar vessels.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Potter's tools include potter's needles, ribs, scrapers, a knife, and calipers.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in identifying ceramic objects, including when they were created and their likely place or culture of origin.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation, Perception
entries: You gain additional insight when inspecting ceramics, uncovering clues others would overlook by spotting minor irregularities.

additionalEntries.name: Reconstruction
entries: By examining pottery shards, you can determine an object's original, intact form and its likely purpose.

additionalEntries.caption: Potter's Tools
rows: Determine what a vessel once held
Find a weak point in a ceramic object

item.name: Pouch
entries: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 {@item sling bullet|phb|sling bullets} or 50 {@item blowgun needle|phb|blowgun needles}, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a {@item component pouch|phb}. A pouch can hold up to ⅕ cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

item.name: Powdered Chrysolite
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|PHB}.

item.name: Powdered Corn Extract
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Rope Trick|PHB}.

item.name: Powdered Rhubarb Leaf
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Melf's Acid Arrow|PHB}.

item.name: Powdered Silver
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Dispel Evil and Good|PHB}.

item.name: Prayer Wheel
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Regenerate|PHB}.

item.name: Pride Silk
entries: The hearty silk unique to the region has long been a point of pride with the locals. When processed and woven properly, the resulting cloth is pride silk: an extremely flexible material with the durability of tanned leather. Pride silk has become a favorite cloth for use on military ship sails, war banners, and other utilitarian applications, but has also gained popularity in affluent circles. High-end clothing made from pride silk is both fashionable and protective, leading many nobles and wealthy merchants to seek full outfits and formal gowns made with it. The tailors skilled enough to create such outfits are few and far between, so while pride silk might be expensive as a raw material, outfits made of the cloth are prohibitively expensive for most common folk.

item.name: Pride Silk Outfit
entries: An outfit made of pride silk weighs 4 pounds and costs 500 gp. If you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 11 + your Dexterity modifier while wearing it.

item.name: Priest's Pack
entries: Includes:

items: a {@item backpack|phb}
a {@item blanket|phb}
10 {@item candle|phb|candles}
a {@item tinderbox|phb}
an alms box
2 blocks of incense
a censer
vestments
2 days of {@item Rations (1 day)|phb|rations}
a {@item waterskin|phb}.

item.name: Purple Worm Poison
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@condition incapacitated} {@creature purple worm}. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Quarterstaff
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Shillelagh|PHB}.

item.name: Quiver
entries: A quiver can hold up to 20 {@item arrow|phb|arrows}.

item.name: Quiver Containing at Least One Piece of Ammunition
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Swift Quiver|PHB}.

item.name: Rations (1 day)
entries: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

item.name: Red Dragon's Scale
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|XGE}.

item.name: Ring Mail
entries: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

item.name: Ring Mail Barding
entries: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

item.name: Rod of Amber
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Lightning Bolt|PHB}.

item.name: Rose Petals
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sleep|PHB}.

item.name: Rotten Egg
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Stinking Cloud|PHB}.

item.name: Rowboat
entries: Keelboats and rowboats are used on lakes and rivers, If going downstream, add the speed of the current (typically 3 miles per hour) to the speed of the vehicle. These vehicles can't be rowed against any significant current, but they can be pulled upstream by draft animals on the shores. A rowboat weighs 100 pounds, in case adventurers carry it over land.

item.name: Sack
entries: A sack can hold up to 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

item.name: Salt
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Comprehend Languages|PHB}.

item.name: Sand
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Move Earth|PHB}.

item.name: Sand for Water
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Elemental|PHB}.

item.name: Sand That Is Colored Red
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Color Spray|PHB}.

item.name: Scale Mail
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: Scale Mail Barding
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: Scholar's Pack
entries: Includes:

items: a {@item backpack|phb}
a {@item book|phb} of lore
a {@item Ink (1-ounce bottle)|phb|bottle of ink}
an {@item ink pen|phb}
10 {@item Parchment (one sheet)|phb|sheets of parchment}
a little bag of sand
a small knife.

item.name: Scrap of Black Paper
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Invisibility to Cameras (UA)|UAModernMagic}.

item.name: Serpent Venom
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@condition incapacitated} {@creature giant poisonous snake}. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Seven Sharp Thorns
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Spike Growth|PHB}.

item.name: Seven Small Twigs
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Spike Growth|PHB}.

item.name: Several Seeds of Any Moonseed Plant
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Moonbeam|PHB}.

item.name: Several Skunk Cabbage Leaves
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Stinking Cloud|PHB}.

item.name: Shamrock Leaf
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Shillelagh|PHB}.

item.name: Shaving of Licorice Root
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Haste|PHB}.

item.name: Shawm
entries: A double-reed instrument similar to an oboe or a bassoon, popular with gnomes, who have developed some bellows-powered versions.

item.name: Shell Casing
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Protection from Ballistics (UA)|UAModernMagic}.

item.name: Shield
entries: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: Short Piece of Copper Wire
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Message|PHB}.

item.name: Short Piece of Fine Copper Wire
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sending|PHB}.

item.name: Short Reed
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Water Breathing|PHB}.

item.name: Silk Rope (50 feet)
entries: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, instead of {@dice 2d4}.

item.name: Silvered Hooked Shortspear
entries: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: Silvered Light Repeating Crossbow
entries: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

item.name: Silvered Yklwa
entries: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

item.name: Similar Appendage
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Freedom of Movement|PHB}.

item.name: Sliver of Glass
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Cloud of Daggers|PHB}.

item.name: Small
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hold Monster|PHB} and {@spell Hold Person|PHB}.

item.name: Small Amount of Alcohol
entries: A spell component used in {@spell False Life|PHB}.

item.name: Small Amount of Makeup Applied to the Face as This Spell Is Cast
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Friends|PHB}.

item.name: Small Bag Containing a Mixture of Soils—clay
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Move Earth|PHB}.

item.name: Small Block of Granite
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Wall of Stone|PHB}.

item.name: Small Clay Model of a Ziggurat
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Tongues|PHB}.

item.name: Small Crystal
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Cone of Cold|PHB}.

item.name: Small Crystal Bead
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Leomund's Tiny Hut|PHB}.

item.name: Small Crystal Sphere
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Otiluke's Freezing Sphere|PHB}.

item.name: Small Parchment with a Bit of Holy Text Written on It
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Shield of Faith|PHB}.

item.name: Small Piece of Copper Wire
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Digital Phantom (UA)|UAModernMagic}.

item.name: Small Piece of Phosphorus
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Wall of Fire|PHB}.

item.name: Small Piece of Quartz
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Wall of Ice|PHB}.

item.name: Small Silver Mirror
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Sanctuary|PHB}.

item.name: Small Sprinkling of Powdered Silver
entries: A spell component used in {@spell See Invisibility|PHB}.

item.name: Small Square of Silk
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Nystul's Magic Aura|PHB}.

item.name: Small White Rock Chip
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE}.

item.name: Smear of Fat
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Insect Plague|PHB}.

item.name: Smith's Tools
additionalEntries: Smith's tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, repair damage, or work raw ingots into useful items.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Smith's tools include hammers, tongs, charcoal, rags, and a whetstone.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana and History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining metal objects, such as weapons.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: You can spot clues and make deductions that others might overlook when an investigation involves armor, weapons, or other metalwork.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: With access to your tools and an open flame hot enough to make metal pliable, you can restore 10 hit points to a damaged metal object for each hour of work.

item.name: Snake's Tongue
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mass Suggestion|PHB} and {@spell Suggestion|PHB}.

item.name: Snakeskin Glove
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Bigby's Hand|PHB}.

item.name: Soft Clay
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Stone Shape|PHB}.

item.name: Soft Clay for Earth
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Elemental|PHB}.

item.name: Some Kernels of Grain
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Insect Plague|PHB}.

item.name: Songhorn
entries: A recorder, a simple type of flute, usually carved from wood.

item.name: Soothsalts
entries: Soothsalts are derived from a naturally occurring crystalline substance discovered throughout the wilds of the Miskath Strand. The crimson crystals have been mined from cavernous veins like those in the mouth of the Miskath Pit and found within smaller geode formations near sites ravaged by the Calamity. Soothsalts are consumed orally in lozenge-sized doses, and frequent users can be identified by the telltale crimson stain around their mouths. A creature subjected to a dose of soothsalts gains advantage on all Intelligence checks for {@dice 1d4} hours.
For each dose of soothsalts consumed, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}—an effect which is cumulative with multiple doses.

item.name: Spellbook
entries: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

item.name: Spider
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Spider Climb|PHB}.

item.name: Spiked Armor
entries: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

item.name: Spiked Barding
entries: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

item.name: Splint Armor
entries: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

item.name: Splint Barding
entries: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

item.name: Sprig of Mistletoe
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Goodberry|PHB}.

item.name: Sprig of Spruce
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Pass Without Trace|PHB}.

item.name: Sprinkling of Holy Water
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Bless|PHB}.

item.name: Spyglass
entries: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

item.name: Square of Black Silk
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Negative Energy Flood|XGE}.

item.name: Stone
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hallucinatory Terrain|PHB}.

item.name: Straight Piece of Iron
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hold Monster|PHB} and {@spell Hold Person|PHB}.

item.name: Studded Leather Armor
entries: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Studded Leather Barding
entries: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: Sulfur
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Elemental|PHB}, {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball|PHB}, {@spell Fireball|PHB}, and {@spell Melf's Minute Meteors|XGE}.

item.name: Survival Mantle
entries: This carapace-like augmentation encases portions of the wearer's shoulders, neck, and chest. A survival mantle is equivalent to a suit of nonmagical half plate armor and takes just as long to don or doff. It can't be worn with other kinds of armor.

A creature wearing a survival mantle can breathe normally in any environment (including a vacuum) and has advantage on saving throws against harmful gases (such as those created by a {@spell cloudkill} spell, a {@spell stinking cloud} spell, inhaled poisons, and the breath weapons of some dragons).

item.name: Tankard
entries: A tankard holds 1 pint of liquid.

item.name: Tantan
entries: A tambourine, a popular instrument with halflings and humans south of the Dalelands.

item.name: The Heart of a Hen
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Fear|PHB} and {@spell Feather Fall|PHB}.

item.name: The Petrified Eye of a Newt
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hex|PHB}.

item.name: The Stem of a Plant with Thorns
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Thorn Whip|PHB}.

item.name: Theki Root
entries: This thick marsh root tastes bitter but is thought to aid digestive health. When you use an action to consume a dose, you gain advantage on saving throws against the effects of poisonous or toxic substances for 8 hours.

item.name: Thelarr
entries: Also known as a whistlecane, a simple and easy-to-make wind instrument cut from a reed. They are so simple, in fact, that skilled bards frequently make and give them away to children—to the parents' delight or regret.

item.name: Thieves' Tools
entries: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.
additionalEntries: Perhaps the most common tools used by adventurers, thieves' tools are designed for picking locks and foiling traps. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of traps and locks.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Thieves' tools include a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: Your knowledge of traps grants you insight when answering questions about locations that are renowned for their traps.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation and Perception
entries: You gain additional insight when looking for traps, because you have learned a variety of common signs that betray their presence.

additionalEntries.name: Set a Trap
entries: Just as you can disable traps, you can also set them. As part of a short rest, you can create a trap using items you have on hand. The total of your check becomes the DC for someone else's attempt to discover or disable the trap. The trap deals damage appropriate to the materials used in crafting it (such as poison or a weapon) or damage equal to half the total of your check, whichever the DM deems appropriate.

item.name: Thin Sheet of Lead
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|PHB}.

item.name: Thread
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound|PHB}.

item.name: Three Nut Shells
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Confusion|PHB}.

item.name: Three Silver Pins
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Chain Lightning|PHB}.

item.name: Thrown Weapon
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Barrage|PHB}.

item.name: Tinderbox
entries: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

item.name: Tinker's Tools
additionalEntries: A set of tinker's tools is designed to enable you to repair many mundane objects. Though you can't manufacture much with tinker's tools, you can mend torn clothes, sharpen a worn sword, and patch a tattered suit of chain mail.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Tinker's tools include a variety of hand tools, thread, needles, a whetstone, scraps of cloth and leather, and a small pot of glue.

additionalEntries.name: History
entries: You can determine the age and origin of objects, even if you have only a few pieces remaining from the original.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: When you inspect a damaged object, you gain knowledge of how it was damaged and how long ago.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: You can restore 10 hit points to a damaged object for each hour of work. For any object, you need access to the raw materials required to repair it. For metal objects, you need access to an open flame hot enough to make the metal pliable.

additionalEntries.caption: Tinker's Tools
rows: Repair an item in half the time
Improvise a temporary item using scraps

item.name: Tiny Ball of Bat Guano
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball|PHB} and {@spell Fireball|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Bell
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Alarm|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Fan
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Wind Wall|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Piece of Matter of the Same Type of the Item You Plan to Create
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Creation|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Silver Whistle
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Strip of White Cloth
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Aid|PHB}.

item.name: Tiny Tarts
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|PHB}.

item.name: Tocken
entries: A hanging set of carved oval bells, usually played with a pair of light wooden hammers (or open handed). They are most common in underground cultures, where the resonant tones can carry.

item.name: Torch
entries: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

item.name: Torpor
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 4d6} hours. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition incapacitated}.

item.name: Trinket
entries: When you make your character, you can roll once on the Trinkets table to gain a trinket, a simple item lightly touched by mystery. The DM might also use this table. It can help stock a room in a dungeon or fill a creatures pockets.

entries.caption: Player's Handbook Trinket Table
rows: A piece of crystal that faintly glows in the moonlight
A gold coin minted in an unknown land
A diary written in a language you don't know
A brass ring that never tarnishes
An old chess piece made from glass
A pair of knucklebone dice, each with a skull symbol on the side that would normally show six pips
A small idol depicting a nightmarish creature that gives you unsettling dreams when you sleep near it
A rope necklace from which dangles four mummified elf fingers
The deed for a parcel of land in a realm unknown to you
A 1-ounce block made from an unknown material
A small cloth doll skewered with needles
A tooth from an unknown beast
An enormous scale, perhaps from a dragon
An old divination card bearing your likeness
A glass orb filled with moving smoke
A 1-pound egg with a bright red shell
A glass jar containing a weird bit of flesh floating in pickling fluid
A tiny gnome-crafted music box that plays a song you dimly remember from your childhood
A small wooden statuette of a smug halfling
A brass orb etched with strange runes
A tiny silver icon of a raven
A bag containing forty-seven humanoid teeth, one of which is rotten
A shard of obsidian that always feels warm to the touch
A dragon's bony talon hanging from a plain leather necklace
A blank book whose pages refuse to hold ink, chalk, graphite, or any other substance or marking
A silver badge in the shape of a five-pointed star
A knife that belonged to a relative
A glass vial filled with nail clippings
A rectangular metal device with two tiny metal cups on one end that throws sparks when wet
A white, sequined glove sized for a human
A vest with one hundred tiny pockets
A tiny sketch portrait of a goblin
An empty glass vial that smells of perfume when opened
A gemstone that looks like a lump of coal when examined by anyone but you
A scrap of cloth from an old banner
A rank insignia from a lost legionnaire
A tiny silver bell without a clapper
A mechanical canary inside a gnomish lamp
A tiny chest carved to look like it has numerous feet on the bottom
A dead {@creature sprite} inside a clear glass bottle
A metal can that has no opening but sounds as if it is filled with liquid, sand, spiders, or broken glass (your choice)
A glass orb filled with water, in which swims a clockwork goldfish
A silver spoon with an 'M' engraved on the handle
A whistle made from gold-colored wood
A dead scarab beetle the size of your hand
Two toy soldiers, one with a missing head
A small box filled with different-sized buttons
A candle that can't be lit
A tiny cage with no door
A hilt from a broken sword
A cameo carved in the likeness of a hideous person
A silver skull the size of a coin
A pyramid of sticky black incense that smells very bad
A nightcap that, when worn, gives you pleasant dreams
A single caltrop made from bone
A gold monocle frame without the lens
A 1-inch cube, each side painted a different color
A crystal knob from a door
A small packet filled with pink dust
A fragment of a beautiful song, written as musical notes on two pieces of parchment
A silver teardrop earring made from a real teardrop
The shell of an egg painted with scenes of human misery in disturbing detail
A fan that, when unfolded, shows a sleeping cat
A four-leaf clover pressed inside a book discussing manners and etiquette
A sheet of parchment upon which is drawn a complex mechanical contraption
An ornate scabbard that fits no blade you have found so far
An invitation to a party where a murder happened
A bronze pentacle with an etching of a rat's head in its center
A purple handkerchief embroidered with the name of a powerful {@creature archmage}
Half of a floorplan for a temple, castle, or some other structure
A bit of folded cloth that, when unfolded, turns into a stylish cap
A receipt of deposit at a bank in a far-flung city
A diary with seven missing pages
An empty silver snuffbox bearing an inscription on the surface that says "dreams"
An iron holy symbol devoted to an unknown god
A book that tells the story of a legendary hero's rise and fall, with the last chapter missing
An ancient arrow of elven design
An ornate brooch of dwarven design
An empty wine bottle bearing a pretty label that says, "The Wizard of Wines Winery, Red Dragon Crush, 331422-W"
A mosaic tile with a multicolored, glazed surface
A black pirate flag adorned with a dragon's skull and crossbones
A tiny mechanical crab or spider that moves about when it's not being observed
A glass jar containing lard with a label that reads, "Griffon Grease"
A wooden box with a ceramic bottom that holds a living worm with a head on each end of its body
A metal urn containing the ashes of a hero

item.name: Truth Serum
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. The {@condition poisoned} creature can't knowingly speak a lie, as if under the effect of a {@spell zone of truth} spell.

item.name: Twig
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Hallucinatory Terrain|PHB}.

item.name: Twig from a Tree That Has Been Struck by Lightning
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Witch Bolt|PHB}.

item.name: Twisted Loop of Parchment
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Rope Trick|PHB}.

item.name: Two Lodestones
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mending|PHB}.

item.name: Two-Person Tent
entries: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

item.name: Unholy Water
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Commune|PHB}.

item.name: Vial
entries: A vial can hold up to 4 ounces of liquid.

item.name: Vial of Blood from a Humanoid Killed Within the Past 24 Hours
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Summon Greater Demon|XGE} and {@spell Summon Lesser Demons|XGE}.

item.name: Vial of Blood from an Intelligent Humanoid Killed Within the Past 24 Hours
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Lesser Demon (UA)|UAThatOldBlackMagic} and {@spell Conjure Shadow Demon (UA)|UAThatOldBlackMagic}.

item.name: Vial of Holy
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Commune|PHB}.

item.name: Wad of Cotton
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum|PHB}.

item.name: Wargong
entries: A metal gong, traditionally made from a shield, particularly the shield of an enemy. Both goblins and dwarves make and play wargongs, their sound echoing through tunnels in the Underdark.

item.name: Water
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Conjure Elemental|PHB}, {@spell Flesh to Stone|PHB}, and {@spell Transmute Rock|XGE}.

item.name: Waterskin
entries: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

item.name: Weapon
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Booming blade|tce} and {@spell Green-flame blade|tce}.

item.name: Weaver's Tools
additionalEntries: Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Weaver's tools include thread, needles, and scraps of cloth. You know how to work a loom, but such equipment is too large to transport.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining cloth objects, including cloaks and robes.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: Using your knowledge of the process of creating cloth objects, you can spot clues and make deductions that others would overlook when you examine tapestries, upholstery, clothing, and other woven items.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged cloth object.

additionalEntries.name: Craft Clothing
entries: Assuming you have access to sufficient cloth and thread, you can create an outfit for a creature as part of a long rest.

additionalEntries.caption: Weaver's Tools
rows: Mend a hole in a piece of cloth

item.name: White Feather
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Fear|PHB} and {@spell Feather Fall|PHB}.

item.name: Willowshade Oil
entries: A dark blue oil can be extracted from the rare fruit of the willowshade plant. A creature can use its action to apply the oil to another creature that has been {@condition petrified} for less than 1 minute, causing the {@condition petrified} condition on that creature to end at the start of what would be that creature's next turn.

item.name: Wing Feather from Any Bird
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Fly|PHB}.

item.name: Wisp of Smoke
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Gaseous Form|PHB} and {@spell True Polymorph|PHB}.

item.name: Wood Mixed in Water
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Control Weather|PHB}.

item.name: Woodcarver's Tools
additionalEntries: Woodcarver's tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Woodcarver's tools consist of a knife, a gouge, and a small saw.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana, History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when you examine wooden objects, such as figurines or arrows.

additionalEntries.name: Nature
entries: Your knowledge of wooden objects gives you some added insight when you examine trees.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: As part of a short rest, you can repair a single damaged wooden object.

additionalEntries.name: Craft Arrows
entries: As part of a short rest, you can craft up to five arrows. As part of a long rest, you can craft up to twenty. You must have enough wood on hand to produce them.

additionalEntries.caption: Woodcarver's Tools
rows: Carve an intricate pattern in wood

item.name: Writing Quill Plucked from a Sleeping Bird
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Dream|PHB}.

item.name: Wychwood
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Dancing Lights|PHB}.

item.name: Wyvern Poison
entries: This poison must be harvested from a dead or {@condition incapacitated} {@creature wyvern}. A creature subjected to this poison must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Yarting
entries: A southern instrument from Amn and Calimshan that is a Faerûnian analog to the guitar. Numerous variations have spread across the continent.

item.name: Yellow
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Color Spray|PHB}.

item.name: Yew Leaf
entries: A spell component used in {@spell Detect Poison and Disease|PHB}.

item.name: Zulkoon
entries: A complex pump organ that originated with the zulkirs of Thay, who use it in the casting of their spells. It is considered to have a dramatic, but sinister, sound.

item.name: +1 All-Purpose Tool
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|PHB}). Whatever form the tool takes, you are proficient with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +1 bonus to the spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your artificer spells.

As an action, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Amulet of the Devout
entries: This amulet bears the symbol of a deity inlaid with precious stones or metals. While you wear the holy symbol, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Arcane Grimoire
entries: While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your wizard spells.
You can use this book as a spellbook. In addition, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can increase the number of spell slot levels you regain by 1.

item.name: +1 Bloodwell Vial
entries: To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells.
In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Breastplate
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

item.name: +1 Chain Mail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: +1 Chain Shirt
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, instead of {@dice 2d4}.

item.name: +1 Dragonhide Belt
entries: This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an action to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Half Plate Armor
entries: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

item.name: +1 Hide Armor
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: +1 Hooked Shortspear
entries: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: +1 Leather Armor
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

item.name: +1 Light Repeating Crossbow
entries: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

item.name: +1 Moon Sickle
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your druid and ranger spells. In addition, you can use the sickle as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored, provided you are holding the sickle.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

item.name: +1 Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: +1 Plate Armor
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

item.name: +1 Rhythm-Maker's Drum
entries: While holding this {@item drum|PHB}, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your bard spells.
As an action, you can play the {@item drum|PHB} to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the {@item drum|PHB} can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Ring Mail
entries: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

item.name: +1 Rod of the Pact Keeper
entries: While holding this rod, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your warlock spells.
In addition, you can regain one warlock spell slot as an action while holding the rod. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +1 Scale Mail
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: +1 Shield
entries: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: +1 Spiked Armor
entries: Spiked armor is a rare type of medium armor made by dwarves. It consists of a leather coat and leggings covered with spikes that are usually made of metal.

item.name: +1 Splint Armor
entries: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

item.name: +1 Studded Leather Armor
entries: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

item.name: +1 Wand of the War Mage
entries: While you are holding this wand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.

item.name: +1 Yklwa
entries: A yklwa (pronounced YICK-ul-wah) is a simple melee weapon that is the traditional weapon of Chultan warriors. A yklwa consists of a 3-foot wooden shaft with a steel or stone blade up to 18 inches long. Although it has the thrown weapon property, the yklwa is not well balanced for throwing.

item.name: +2 All-Purpose Tool
entries: This simple screwdriver can transform into a variety of tools; as an action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of artisan's tool of your choice (see the "Equipment" chapter in the {@book Player's Handbook|PHB} for a list of {@item artisan's tools|PHB}). Whatever form the tool takes, you are proficient with it.
While holding this tool, you gain a +2 bonus to the spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your artificer spells.

As an action, you can focus on the tool to channel your creative forces. Choose a cantrip that you don't know from any class list. For 8 hours, you can cast that cantrip, and it counts as an artificer cantrip for you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Amulet of the Devout
entries: This amulet bears the symbol of a deity inlaid with precious stones or metals. While you wear the holy symbol, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
While you wear this amulet, you can use your Channel Divinity feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Arcane Grimoire
entries: While you are holding this leather-bound book, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your wizard spells, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your wizard spells.
You can use this book as a spellbook. In addition, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can increase the number of spell slot levels you regain by 1.

item.name: +2 Bloodwell Vial
entries: To attune to this vial, you must place a few drops of your blood into it. The vial can't be opened while your attunement to it lasts. If your attunement to the vial ends, the contained blood turns to ash. You can use the vial as a spellcasting focus for your spells while wearing or holding it, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells.
In addition, when you roll any Hit Dice to recover hit points while you are carrying the vial, you can regain 5 sorcery points. This property of the vial can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Breastplate
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

item.name: +2 Chain Mail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

item.name: +2 Chain Shirt
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

entries.name: Special
entries: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, instead of {@dice 2d4}.

item.name: +2 Dragonhide Belt
entries: This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +2 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an action to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Half Plate Armor
entries: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

item.name: +2 Hide Armor
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

item.name: +2 Hooked Shortspear
entries: On a hit with this weapon, the wielder can forgo dealing damage and attempt to trip the target, in which case the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. The DC is 8 + the wielder's Strength modifier + the wielder's proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Special
entries: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

item.name: +2 Leather Armor
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

item.name: +2 Light Repeating Crossbow
entries: This crossbow is fitted with a cartridge that can hold up to six crossbow bolts. It automatically reloads after firing until the cartridge runs out of ammunition. Reloading the cartridge takes an action.

item.name: +2 Moon Sickle
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. While holding this magic weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your druid and ranger spells. In addition, you can use the sickle as a spellcasting focus for your druid and ranger spells.
When you cast a spell that restores hit points, you can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the amount of hit points restored, provided you are holding the sickle.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

item.name: Absorbing Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features designs that emphasize one color.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you have resistance to a type of damage associated with that color, as shown on the table below. The DM chooses the color or determines it randomly.

entries.name: Damage Absorption
entries: When you take damage of the chosen type, you can use your reaction to gain immunity against that instance of the damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this reaction is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items: Acid Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Cold Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Fire Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Force Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Lightning Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Necrotic Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Poison Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Psychic Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Radiant Absorbing Tattoo|TCE
Thunder Absorbing Tattoo|TCE

entries: If you attack with a double-bladed scimitar as part of the {@action Attack} action on your turn, you can use a bonus action immediately after to make a melee attack with it. This attack deals {@dice 1d4} slashing damage on a hit, instead of {@dice 2d4}.

item.name: Acid Absorbing Tattoo
entries: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features designs that emphasize one color (green).

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Damage Absorption
entries: When you take acid damage, you can use your reaction to gain immunity against that instance of the damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this reaction is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.
